abstract: Eleven of the fifty-five delegates that attended the Federal Convention took notes during the proceedings. These notes, along with Jacksons official journal and available committee drafts, are assembled in Farrands Records of the Federal Convention of 1787. The best known are Major Wm. Jackson and James Madison, the conventions official Secretary and its unofficial note-taker, respectively. The efforts of all twelve note-takers are surveyed by output.
title: Table Annexed to Article: A Survey of the Federal Convention's Note-Takers
subject: law
